questions.text: What is the smallest word in the English language that can be made with the featured letter of this quiz?
questions.explanation:
I.

	I is the smallest word starting with I in the English language. I is a first person singular pronoun.

questions.text: Which of these words means "the odd traits that we all have"?
questions.explanation:
idiosyncrasies.

	Idiosyncrasies are the little things that make people unique.

questions.text: In which of the four "I" states in the USA was Michael Jackson born?
questions.explanation:
Indiana.

	Michael Jackson was born on August 29, 1958 in Gary, Indiana.

questions.text: What is the name of the girl that Cornelius Hackl falls in love with in "Hello, Dolly!"
questions.explanation:
Irene Molloy.

	Irene Molloy was played by Eileen Brennan in the original Broadway cast.

Independence Day in Fiji.

	Independence Day for the United States is July 4th. Independence Day in Uganda is October 9th. Independence Day in Fiji is October 10th. Independence Day in Mexico is September 16th.

questions.text: What does the I stand for in IRS (in the United States of America)?
questions.explanation:
Internal.

	The IRS got its start in 1862 while Lincoln was president. For more information about the IRS' history you can go to http://www.irs.gov/irs/article/0,,id=98142,00.html.

questions.text: In the Periodic Table of Elements, what does "I" stand for?
questions.explanation:
Iodine.

	Iodine's atomic number is 53. Its atomic weight is 126.90447. Its standard state is a solid. It is non-metallic. This information was found at WebElements. http://www.webelements.com/webelements/elements/text/I/key.html

questions.text: During a baseball game, what does the "I" stand for in RBI?
questions.explanation:
in.

	"Runs batted in" means that the batter either hit the ball or got a walk that allowed other players to score. Baseball History: October 10, 1920: Bill Wambsganss who played with the Indians is the only player in the history of World Series to make a triple play without any help from his teammates. First he caught a ball that was hit in the air, then he stepped on second base with the ball. After that he tagged the man out on first base.  You can get more on this date in baseball history at: http://www.nationalpastime.com/.

questions.text: In Math, what does a 8 on its side represent?
questions.explanation:
infinity.

	Infinity is used a lot in calculus.

Iceland.

	The first people in Iceland were Norseman from Scandinavia in the 9th Century.
